title: What is the difference between imperative and exclamatory sentence? - Quora

response.answer_text: IMPERATIVE SENTENCES A sentence which contains request, order, entreaty, wish, or command is called an imperative sentence. Please come in. ( Request ) Have pity on tame animals. ( Request ) Be quiet .( order ) Get out .( order ) Go to bed.( order ) Put off the fan. Request /order ) Forgive me. (Entreaty) God save India .( wish ) You must look up this word in a dictionary . ( obligation / necessity ) You ought to respect your age old parents. ( moral obligation ) She should share the money with her family members . (duty ) You have to save the money for your future. ( compulsion ) Note : The ideas of obligation or necessity ( duty , compulsion, force )are generally expressed by using the special verbs like should, must, ought to, have to, be to etc., ) All of you get lost . ( Command ) Let’s invite them. ( polite request /suggestion ) Let’s remind her . ( polite request /suggestion ) Let’s not waste our time . ( request ) Let us enjoy this serial. ( request ) Let A be equal to B . ( impersonal imperative : no request or action. Let someone awakes us at 2 AM . ( Personal imperative : request ) Let him wait for us. ( Personal imperative : order Let no person see your answer paper . Note : Let is used with an infinitive or V1 verb form to make a order / request .And at times no specific order or request. You are to reach airport three hours before departure time. No one is permitted to enter my chamber without previous permission. They are not supposed to lock the main gate during day time. Note : verb be with an infinitive is used expressing order or prohibitions. Be careful . ( instruction ) Turn to right . ( instruction ) Keep away from children and heat . ( instruction ) Keep in a cool dry place . ( instruction ) No u-turn. ( order ) Left free lance .( order ) Answer any three questions. ( Command / request ) All questions are compulsory . ( Command ) All questions carry equal marks ( instructions / command ) No whispering . ( order ) Trespassers will be prosecuted. ( command ) Stop talking . (order /Command ) Hold your tongue. (order /Command ) Follow me. (order /Command ) No copying . ( Command ) No parking . ( Command ) Don’t pluck flowers . ( Command ) May God bless you !( blessing / wish/hope ) Halt . ( order ) Don’t stop. ( order ) Read good books . ( advice ) Will you please post his letter for me ? ( polite request ) EXCLAMATORY SENTENCE : A sentence which contains sudden change of emotions /strong feelings is called an exclamatory sentence. Purely exclamatory sentences: How cold it is ! Would that my wife were present ! What a good idea ! What a horrible song ! What a silly mistake to make ! What hard sentences these are ! What beautiful hair that girl has ! How generous of you to have helped me like this ! Mixed exclamatory : Some Interrogative , negatives and exclamatory sentences may also be imperatives . The following sentence differ in their form and function. Here rather than form function carries more weight age. Hurry up ! ( command / exclamatory ) Clear up this mess! ( exclamatory / imperative ) Lend nothing to your neighbours.( Negative and Imperative ) Its false hair , my dear ! ( declarative / exclamatory ) Don’t get excited ! Cool down. ( exclamatory / imperative ) Isn’t she charming !( interrogative / exclamatory ) Would you like to come with me ? ( interrogative / imperative ) Don’t be a fool ! ( exclamatory / instruction ) Don’t shout ! ( exclamatory / instruction/ order )

An imperative sentence is an order or request: Please pass the sugar. Could you turn on the lights? Put that down! Vote for McGuffin on November 8. An exclamatory sentence is a statement made with strong emotion: Oh my God, that lizard swallowed my baby! Let’s go, Mets! Soylent Green is people! Lions and tigers and bears, oh my!
